intro: Monotropastrum tschanbaischanicum var. baranovii, commonly known as the Baranov's moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its unique, fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night. The plant has elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are dark green and glossy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
